trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> comes with a built-in JDBC driver.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> comes with a built-in JDBC driver.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> comes with a built-in JDBC driver.

trans-unit.source: That makes the JDBC API the only API for working with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases. The driver is a native-protocol fully Java technology-enabled driver (Type 4 of the types described under "JDBC Architecture" in <xref format="html" href="http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/overview-141217.html" scope="external">http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/overview-141217.html</xref>).

seg-source.mrk: That makes the JDBC API the only API for working with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases.

The driver is a native-protocol fully Java technology-enabled driver (Type 4 of the types described under "JDBC Architecture" in <xref format="html" href="http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/overview-141217.html" scope="external">http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/overview-141217.html</xref>).

target.mrk: That makes the JDBC API the only API for working with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases.

The driver is a native-protocol fully Java technology-enabled driver (Type 4 of the types described under "JDBC Architecture" in <xref format="html" href="http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/overview-141217.html" scope="external">http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/overview-141217.html</xref>).

trans-unit.source: This section provides reference information about <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s implementation of the JDBC API and documents the way it conforms to the JDBC 3.0 and 4.0 APIs.

seg-source.mrk: This section provides reference information about <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s implementation of the JDBC API and documents the way it conforms to the JDBC 3.0 and 4.0 APIs.

target.mrk: This section provides reference information about <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s implementation of the JDBC API and documents the way it conforms to the JDBC 3.0 and 4.0 APIs.

trans-unit.source: See the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite> for task-oriented instructions on working with the driver.

seg-source.mrk: See the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite> for task-oriented instructions on working with the driver.

target.mrk: See the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite> for task-oriented instructions on working with the driver.

trans-unit.source: This JDBC driver implements the standard JDBC interfaces. When invoked from an application running in the same Java Virtual Machine (JVM) as <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, the JDBC driver supports connections to a <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database in embedded mode. No network transport is required to access the database. In client/server mode, the client application dispatches JDBC requests to the JDBC server over a network; the server, in turn, which runs in the same JVM as <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, sends requests to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> through the embedded JDBC driver.

No network transport is required to access the database.

In client/server mode, the client application dispatches JDBC requests to the JDBC server over a network; the server, in turn, which runs in the same JVM as <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, sends requests to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> through the embedded JDBC driver.

When invoked from an application running in the same Java Virtual Machine (JVM) as <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, the JDBC driver supports connections to a <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database in embedded mode.
No network transport is required to access the database.

In client/server mode, the client application dispatches JDBC requests to the JDBC server over a network; the server, in turn, which runs in the same JVM as <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, sends requests to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> through the embedded JDBC driver.

trans-unit.source: The JDBC implementation provides access to databases and supplies all the required JDBC interfaces. Unimplemented aspects of the JDBC driver return an SQLException with a message stating "Feature not implemented" and an SQLState of XJZZZ. These unimplemented parts are for features not supported by .

Unimplemented aspects of the JDBC driver return an SQLException with a message stating "Feature not implemented" and an SQLState of XJZZZ.
These unimplemented parts are for features not supported by <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
